Equipping Monsters.interaction: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token[].
Equipping Monsters.example: "The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. For example, if a "Photon Token" that was Special Summoned by the effect of Photon Sanctuary is equipped to "The Grand Jupiter", the second effect of "The Grand Jupiter" will increase its own ATK by the original ATK of the equipped "Photon Token", which is 2000.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token

Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.interaction: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone[].
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.example: "The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. The equipped Token cannot be targeted when activating the last effect of "The Grand Jupiter" that Special Summons one of the monsters equipped to it.
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone

Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.interaction: Another example being "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye": it cannot summon a Token from the Spell/Trap Zone[].
Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye"

Change to Face-down Defense Position.interaction: If a card that has counters placed on itself is flipped face-down, those counters are removed[].

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters that can only be placed on a particular card like itself are placed on a card that has its effects negated, those counters are removed[].
Negate Effects.example: If a "Gateway to Chaos" that had Spell Counters placed on itself by its effect that says "Each time a Monster Card(s) is sent from the hand or field to the Graveyard, place 1 Spell Counter on this card for each of those cards" has its effects negated by an effect like "Silent Swordsman LV7", the Spell Counters are removed.

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters are placed on another card by an effect that places counters, even if the effects of that card are negated, the counters are not removed[].
Negate Effects.example: Ice Counters placed by the effect of "Snowdust Giant" that says "reveal any number of WATER monsters from your hand, and place that many Ice Counters on face-up monsters on the field" are not removed if "Snowdust Giant" has its effects negated.

Unaffected.interaction:
Placing a counter affects the monster[]:
  • A monster (1) that has a counter placed on it and an effect is applying to all monsters with that counter (2). Even if (1) becomes unaffected by cards' effects, the counter is not removed and (2) keeps applying and affecting (1).
  • A monster (1) is unaffected or becomes unaffected by cards' effects. Subsequent effects that try to put counters on (1) will not put any counter on (1).
Unaffected.example: A monster has had a "Cubic Counter" placed on it by the effect of "Vijam the Cubic Seed". Once a monster has had a "Cubic Counter" placed on it, even if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" is then applied to the monster, the "Cubic Counter" is not removed. That monster remains unable to attack, and its effects remain negated. Conversely, if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" has already been applied to a monster, and that monster then battles a "Vijam the Cubic Seed" whose effect then resolves, no "Cubic Counter" will be placed on the monster (As a result, its effects will not be negated, and it will still be able to attack).
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Placing a counter affects the monster

Cannot switch control/possession.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot attach (1) to a monster you control (2) as material as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster, therefore a card or effect that involves such action cannot be activated[].
Cannot switch control/possession.example: Your opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10" , and its "‚óè 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied. In this scenario, you cannot activate the effect of your "Cyber Dragon Infinity" that attaches the target to it as material by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10".
Cannot switch control/possession.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Cyber Dragon Infinity"

Unaffected.interaction: If an effect (1) that involves attaching a card (2) as an Xyz Material to a Xyz Monster on the field (3) is activated, if (3) is unaffected by cards' effects, then (1) resolves without attaching (2) to (3)[].
Unaffected.example: If "Overlay Regen" is activated, but "Forbidden Lance" is chained so that the targeted monster becomes unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects, it is not possible to attach "Overlay Regen" to the targeted monster as an Xyz Material, as it is unaffected by Spell effects. As a result, "Overlay Regen" is sent to the Graveyard. Also, if "Overlay Regen" is activated by targeting a monster that has already become unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects because of "Forbidden Lance", it is still not possible to attach "Overlay Regen" to the targeted monster as an Xyz Material.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attaching material affects the monster being attached to

Attack directly.interaction:
Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once and can attack directly[]:
  • After attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each.
  • If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.example: If the effect of "Bujingi Ophidian" is applied to "Bujintei Susanowo", after attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each. If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once each cannot attack the opponent directly afterwards and vice versa.

Change attack target.interaction: If a monster (1) can attack all opponent's monsters once each, if it attacks a monster (2) but then its attack is redirected to another monster (3), (1) cannot attack again (2). Furthermore, (3) which has been made the attack target instead of (2), if (3) has not been destroyed by battle after the attack redirection, (1) cannot attack again (3)[].
Change attack target.example: A "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike" attacks an opponent's "Ruffian Railcar", but the opponent activates the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" from their hand, and damage calculation is performed. In this case, since the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" makes itself the attack target, it cannot be attacked again by "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike". In addition, the "Ruffian Railcar" which was attacked when the opponent activated the effect of Construction "Train Signal Red" also cannot be attacked again.
Change attack target.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attack target redirection and effects that allow attacking all monsters, once each

Negate Effects.interaction:
A monster (1) that can attack all opponent's monsters once each declares its second (or more) attack during the current Battle Phase (a continuous effect is applying). If (1)'s effects become negated[]:
  • If its effects are negated during the Battle Step, it will no longer be possible to continue that attack, or to make additional attacks.
  • If its effects are negated during the Damage Step (by "Forbidden Droplet" for example), damage calculation will be conducted for that attack normally.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Multiple attacks, and the monster's effects being negated while attacking

Negate Effects.interaction:
A monster (1) is in face-up Defense Position and its effect that allows it to attack while in face-up Defense Position applies. If you declare an attack using this effect and an effect (2) that negates (1)'s effects is activated or applied[]:
  • If (1)'s effects are negated during the Battle Step by (2), (1) can no longer attack while being in face-up Defense Position. In this case, the attack stops without entering the Damage Step.
  • If (1)'s effects are negated during the Damage Step, the Damage Step ends without conducting Damage Calculation.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attacking in Defense Position, and negating the attacking monster's effects

Negate Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that banish cards (2) is chained to banish (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be banished due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Negate Effects.example: You chained "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to be banished. Its effect will be negated.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: You can take control of an opponent's monster that's the wrong Type/Attribute with a card like "Mind Control". If you do, it's sent to the Graveyard immediately after you gain control of it[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • Official KONAMI's FAQ of "Rivalry of Warlords" and "Gozen Match"

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If the only monsters your opponent controls are monsters whose control/possession cannot switch, you cannot activate an effect that would take control of an opponent's monster[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example: When your "Goyo King" destroys an opponent's monster by battle, if the only monster your opponent controls is that "Botanical Lion" hose effect is applying (control of it cannot switch), you cannot activate the effect of "Goyo King" that takes control of your opponent's monster.
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Activation legality for attempting to take control

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot equip (1) to a monster you control (2) as an equip card as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster[].
Equipping Monsters.example: Your opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10" , and its "‚óè 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied. In this scenario, you cannot activate the effect of your "Relinquished" that that equips the target to it by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10".
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Relinquished"

Unaffected.interaction: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting[].
Unaffected.example: You control a face-up "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and a face-up "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin", and the opponent controls a "Skypalace Gangaridai" affected by the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora". The effect of "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" that prevents other "Ninja" Monsters you control from being targeted for attacks is an effect that affects the monsters performing attacks. Therefore, in the proposed scenario, since "Skypalace Gangaridai" is not affected by the effects of other cards, "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin" can be targeted for an attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting

Unaffected.interaction: This is true for both effects that say "monsters your opponent controls cannot target X for attacks" like "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and effects that say "your opponent cannot target X for attacks" like "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode": a monster unaffected by those cards can still target them for attacks[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode"

Unaffected.interaction: If you are not applying an effect to the monster, preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster[].
Unaffected.example: "Ancient Gear Fortress" and a "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" which you Fusion Summoned this turn are on the field. Since "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" is unaffected by Spell effects, the "they cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not apply to it. (For example, it could be destroyed by your opponent's monster effects). However, the "your opponent cannot target "Ancient Gear" monsters you control with card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not affect monsters. Therefore, your opponent will still be unable to target "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" with card effects this turn.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster (Unless you are applying an effect to the monster)

Unaffected.interaction: Changing the attack target affects the monster[].
Unaffected.example: When your opponent's "Tatsunoko" attacks directly, you activate the effect of a "Dark Spirit of Banishment" in your hand at the start of the Damage Step, targeting a "Curse Necrofear" in your Graveyard. In this scenario, since your opponent's "Tatsunoko" is unaffected by monster effects, it is unaffected by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment" that changes its attack target and performs damage calculation. Although "Curse Necrofear" is still Special Summoned by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment", it does not become the new attack target, so "Tatsunoko" continues its attack normally as a direct attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing the attack target affects the monster

Negate Activation of Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates the activation of the effects (2) is chained to negate the activations of the effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The the Chain resolves in reverse order and (1) will still negate the (2)'s effects activation[].
Negate Activation of Effects.example: When you Tribute Summon "Mobius the Frost Monarch", you activate its effect. However, your opponent activates the effect of "Stardust Dragon" in response. If you now further activate "Book of Moon" by targeting your "Mobius the Frost Monarch", this chain resolves backwards, and causes "Mobius the Frost Monarch" to be face-down by the time "Stardust Dragon"'s effect resolves. Even if "Mobius the Frost Monarch" is changed to face-down Defense Position, the effect of "Stardust Dragon" will still negate the activation of "Mobius the Frost Monarch"'s effect, and destroy "Mobius the Frost Monarch".
Negate Activation of Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating the activation of a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Effects.interaction: Consider effects that say "when an effect is activated: ...; negate the/that effect" (negating activated effect) like "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates monster's activated effects (2) is chained to negate the activated effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), and the effects of (1) will be still negated[]
Negate Effects.example: When my Level 5 or higher monster activates its effect, "Xyz Wrath" is activated in response. If "Book of Moon" is then activated in response, causing the Level 5 or higher monster to be in face-down Defense Position by the time "Xyz Wrath" resolves, the effect of "Xyz Wrath" will be applied normally (the activated effect is negated, and the monster is destroyed).
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Effects.interaction: Consider effects that negate effects but not the activated effects like "Forbidden Chalice". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (2) is chained to flip (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of (3) will not be applied once (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), so the effect of (1) will not be negated[].
Negate Effects.example: You chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even if a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card is flipped face-down by the effect of "Book of Moon" or something similar, it is flipped face-down in the Main Monster Zone. If it is flipped face-up again, it is treated as a Monster according to what its text indicates[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: If a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card by its own effect is flipped face-down by an effect, it is placed face-down in the Spell & Trap Zone. It can be activated in the next turn and become a Monster Card once again[].
Changing from Monster Trap to Trap, it does not create a new copy[]
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example: If the second effect of "Galaxy Cyclone" is activated by targeting an "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster, and then "Book of Moon" is chained so that "Embodiment of Apophis" is Set, the targeted card is destroyed normally.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing from Monster+Trap to Trap does not create a new copy

If ... would be destroyed, you can do ...interaction: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile[].
If ... would be destroyed, you can do ...example: You have "Toon Kingdom" face-up on your side of the field, and you activate "Comic Hand" by targeting an opponent's "Spirit Reaper". When "Comic Hand" resolves, you take control of the "Spirit Reaper" that was targeted, and it will be treated as a Toon monster. After you gain control of "Spirit Reaper", its effect that destroys it when it is targeted by a card or effect will apply. In this case, you can apply the last effect of "Toon Kingdom" once, and banish the top card of your Deck face-down, but the effect of "Spirit Reaper" will immediately apply again, resulting in "Spirit Reaper" being destroyed.
If ... would be destroyed, you can do ...reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile

Negate Summons.interaction:
The Special Summon of a monster when resolving an effect that happens later (during the End Phase for example) does not start a chain such as "Spellbook of Judgment".
  • As it is a Special Summon of a monster due an effect, this Special Summon cannot be negated by activating effects that negate summons like "Black Horn of Heaven"[].
  • However, it is still an "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)", so cards like "Solemn Warning" can be activated in response[].
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating delayed Special Summons

Unaffected.interaction: Effects that apply later (delayed effects) also applies after the Chain Link formed by their activation has finished resolving. Therefore, they can also affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects"[].
Unaffected.example: "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect will destroy "Cyberdark End Dragon" during the End Phase.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unaffected by activated effects" and what it means

Negate Effects.interaction: If a monster that has been equipped with Equip Cards by its effect has its effects negated, they are destroyed and sent to the Graveyard[].
Negate Effects.example: While "Guardian of Felgrand" has been equipped with a card by its effect that says "If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can equip 1 Level 7 or 8 Dragon-Type monster from your hand or Graveyard to this card.", if the effect of "Skill Drain" is applied, the effects of "Guardian of Felgrand" are negated and the monster that was equipped is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard.

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Unaffected.interaction: Substitution does not affect the protected monster[].
Unaffected.example: If your "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV6", which is unaffected by Spell effects due to its own effect, would be destroyed by battle or card effect, you can apply the effect of "Return of the Dragon Lords" in my Graveyard.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substitution does not affect the protected monster

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: The activation of a card or of an effect can be negated by cards that are able to negate "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)"[].
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Special Summons caused by a card effect, and whether the effect includes Special Summoning

Negate Activation of Effects.interaction: The activation of a card or of an effect can be negated by cards that are able to negate "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)"[].
Negate Activation of Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Special Summons caused by a card effect, and whether the effect includes Special Summoning

Negate Summons.interaction: The Summon of that monster(s) can be negated if the effect resolves as Chain Link 1[].
Negate Summons.example: If "Tenpai Dragon Chundra"'s effect of was activated as Chain Link 1, the effect of "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended" can be activated during the attempt to Synchro Summon; if the effect of "Tenpai Dragon Chundra" was activated as Chain Link 2 or higher, it cannot be.
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Tenpai Dragon Chundra", "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended"

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: Negating a card's activation (not effect's activation) removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field[].
Negate Activation of Cards.example: A "Super Soldier Shield" was set on the field by its own effect. That "Super Soldier Shield" is activated, and it has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit". Since the "Super Soldier Shield" that has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit" is not considered to leave the field, it is not banished and is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard normally.
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a card's activation removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field

Unaffected.interaction: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card[].
Unaffected.example: Your opponent activates the effect of "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" that destroys 1 other card on the field, while it is also unaffected by monster and Trap effects as a result of being Tribute Summoned by Tributing a monster and a Continuous Trap Card. In this case, if you chain "Recall", since "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" is unaffected by Trap Cards, the activation of its effect is not negated by "Recall" and it is not destroyed, so its effect destroys the targeted card normally. Even in that case, your opponent draws 1 card.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card

Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.example: The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8. Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated. In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel". Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
Properties Changing: Copy effect continu.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Properties Changing: Name changing.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Properties Changing: Name changing.example: The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8. Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated. In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel". Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
Properties Changing: Name changing.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Return/Add to the Hand.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that returns cards to the hand (2) is chained to return (1) to the hand. Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be returned to the hand due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Return/Add to the Hand.example: You chained "Compulsory Evacuation Device" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to be returned to the hand. Its effect will be negated.
Return/Add to the Hand.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even when a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card has its effects negated, it remains in the Main Monster Zone[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction:
• After you negate monster effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated, so the card remains in the Monster Zone[].
  • After you negate trap effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up (even if the negation effect is no longer applied, the Trap Card will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again)[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
A Continuous Trap Card that has an effect of becoming a monster, such as "Angel Statue - Azurune", has been Special Summoned to your Monster Zone by applying its own Trap Effect:

  • If the effect of a previously Set "Infinite Impermanence" that negates all other Spell/Trap effects in its column is applied to "Angel Statue - Azurune" in the Monster Zone, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up. (even if the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" is no longer applied, "Angel Statue - Azurune" will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again).
  • However, if just the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" that negates the effects of its target applies to "Angel Statue - Azurune" that is treated as an Effect Monster, only its Monster Effects will be negated. In this case, its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated, so "Angel Statue - Azurune" remains in the Monster Zone.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating monster effects of a Monster/Trap hybrid

During the X Phase, do ... : Delayed eff.interaction: Example: if "Harpie Oracle" is Normal or Special Summoned and activates its effect while the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying, as in this scenario, the effect will not be negated. However, if the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying during the End Phase when you apply "Harpie Oracle"'s effect, you cannot add an appropriate Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand. (If the effect of "Necrovalley" has stopped applying by the time you reach the End Phase, you can add the Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand normally)[].
During the X Phase, do ... : Delayed eff.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Necrovalley and delayed effects

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: The player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example: When your opponent Special Summoned "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" this turn, you activated the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill". During the same turn, if that "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" leaves the field after its control was changed by the effect of "Creature Swap", the player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field (in this scenario, since you were the controller of "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon", you take 3000 damage).
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" and changing control

Unaffected.interaction: You can use "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targeting a monster unaffected by cards effects. In this scenario, the monster's effects won't be negated but the controller of that monster will still take damage when it leaves the field[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targets a monster that is unaffected
